result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Flecha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept of other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
01-22-16/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC with 17 days credit.

STAYED pending a review on 03-25-2016.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 8 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days concurrent in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 3/25/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Ricardo Flecha in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Defendant Ricardo Flecha in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CM3153 and 15CM1554 joined for the purpose of trial.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
